summary:
At eLEAF we provide satellite based data services to increase agricultural performance while aiming to reduce the associated water use. As Business Development Manager I am in contact with both funding organisations as well as potential customers of our services. I am responsible for contract negotiations and client management, and I am involved in our operational projects as project manager, or as support for all eLEAF project managers whenever issues arise. I like the translation of high-tech data solutions to tailor-made applications that optimize the daily operations of the end-user, whether they are public water authorities, agri-businesses or small holder farmers. 

Besides my role as Business Development Manager, I am part of eLEAF's Management Team, and work closely with the MD on business strategy and internal organisation. 

I like working in an international setting. Before joining eLEAF in 2012, I have worked and lived in East-Timor, Indonesia, Sudan, Yemen, Jordan and Argentina on projects in the field of integrated rural development, water supply and sanitation, water management and irrigation.

profile_positions.description:
eLEAF BV is a data- and consultancy company that specializes in the interpretation of satellite images for the agricultural and water management sector. Our core business is to transform data derived through remote sensing techniques to actionable information for farmers and water managers worldwide on irrigation performance, water productivity and crop status that supports them to optimize their production, water use efficiency and water allocation practices. Products range from monitoring applications on field level to decision support systems for entire river basins or continents.    

I work for eLEAF as Acquisition Manager, and I am responsible for project acquisition, which includes coordination of client-, partner- and donor relations, writing of concept notes and project proposals.
profile_positions.title: Acquisition Manager

profile_positions.description: Traveled and lived in New England, United States for 6 months. Primarily based in Boston MA, where I volunteered for the American Red Cross.
profile_positions.title: Travelling / Volunteering

profile_positions.company: Euroconsult Mott MacDonald / BMB Mott MacDonald
profile_positions.description:
•	Business Development for the South East Asia region covering Indonesia, Lao PDR, Cambodia and Vietnam which included inter-departmental coordination and prioritization of upcoming business opportunities on the international donor market, (re)establish relationships with possible future local partners and representatives of international donor institutions  including Asian Development Bank, European Union and AusAid 

•	Project manager for several projects in Indonesia and Vietnam, including a 10 million Euro project "Decentralized Irrigation System Improvement Project", implemented in 14 irrigation schemes throughout Eastern Indonesia (JICA funded). Successfully coordinated the proposal preparations in Indonesia with 7 consortium partners, Regular backstopping visits to Jakarta to assist the Team Leader with client relations, contract addenda, reporting.

•	Bid manager for donor funded projects (Asian Development Bank, World Bank, JICA, European Union, DGIS) coordinating the full tendering process, from pre-qualification stage, to bidding stage and project start-up. This includes proposal budgeting, preparation of consortium agreements, coordination of all proposal inputs and responsible for delivering the end product
profile_positions.title: Project Manager / Business Development South East Asia

profile_positions.company: Euroconsult Mott MacDonald / BMB Mott MacDonald
profile_positions.description:
The assignment consisted of 3 short missions to Juba, South Sudan. The Basic Services Fund provides funds for Sudanese NGOs to support the Government of Southern Sudan (GOSS) to expand health, education and water and sanitation services throughout South Sudan. The fund managed by BMB Mott MacDonald was over 40 million British Pounds. Activities included:

•	Close coordination with the Ministry of Education, Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Water Resources of South Sudan to set GOSS priorities in each sector

•	In close coordination with DFID, developed NGO application guidelines to be used in the call for proposals which incorporated the GOSS priorities 

•	Develop selection criteria, evaluate and rank concept notes and proposals received together with GOSS representatives

•	Present the recommendations for fund recipients to the different line ministries, and facilitate a final selection of recipients by GOSS
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager on the Basic Services Fund Interim Arrangement - South Sudan

profile_positions.description:
Stationed in Dili, East-Timor, for the full term, I worked as AE on the 'Human Security in Rural Timor Leste' project. The project was a broad Rural Development demonstration project of the Government of Timor-Leste implemented by United Nations Dept of Economic and Social Affairs (UNDESA) to strengthen community management of water and renewable energy services in three rural sub-districts. Achievements include:  

•	20 Water User Groups were formed and trained during the pilot phase and now the adapted participatory process forms the basis for a new national WUG policy.

•	Facilitated a participatory planning process for the planning, design and construction of drinking water supply systems in 4 rural communities. 4 new systems were built and another 7 rehabilitated.

•	Developed training on hygiene practices and subsequently piloted the material by training more than 145 teachers and village leaders in over 15 villages.

•	Developed a training method to build the capacity of local village councils in developing strategic development plans for their community. The method included participatory problem tree analysis, prioritization, the writing of a feasible work plan and the independent realisation of the plans by the community.

•	Actively monitored the programme progress of our partner NGOs  responsible for direct field implementation and coordinated the project implementation with national, regional and local government, partner NGO’s, other development organisations and recipient communities.
profile_positions.title: Associate Expert Rural Water Supply and Sanitation - East Timor

profile_positions.description:
•	Supporting the project acquisition process including preparation of letters of interest and coordination of technical proposals for international donor organisations such as World Bank, European Union, Asian Development Bank, Dutch Government

•	Gathering strategic market intelligence on future business opportunities

•	Staffing of international projects
profile_positions.title: Junior Consultant Land and Water
